On the other hand, a menu with only 3 options may be easier for a user to choose from, as they have fewer options to consider.

Telomeres are the protective caps on the ends of chromosomes that shorten with each cell division. Telomere shortening is a hallmark of aging and can lead to cellular senescence, a state in which cells are no longer able to divide. Oxidative stress is the accumulation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) in cells, which can damage cellular components and contribute to aging. Loss of telomerase activity, which is the enzyme responsible for maintaining telomere length, can also contribute to aging.
In summary, while inflammation can occur as a result of aging, it is not a direct cause of aging. The other three options - telomere shortening, oxidative stress, and loss of telomerase activity - are all thought to contribute to aging.
